intro: Heleniastrum puberulum, commonly known as the hairy helene, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Heleniastrum puberulum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
